3477                ClientInternalHelper.getExtendedRawCells(r), r.getExists(), r.isStale(), false));
3478            }
3479          }
3480          boolean sizeLimitReached = scannerContext.checkSizeLimit(LimitScope.BETWEEN_ROWS);
3481          boolean timeLimitReached = scannerContext.checkTimeLimit(LimitScope.BETWEEN_ROWS);
3482          boolean resultsLimitReached = numOfResults >= maxResults;
3483          limitReached = sizeLimitReached || timeLimitReached || resultsLimitReached;
3484
3485          if (limitReached || !moreRows) {
3486            // With block size limit, we may exceed size limit without collecting any results.
3487            // In this case we want to send heartbeat and/or cursor. We don't want to send heartbeat
3488            // or cursor if results were collected, for example for cell size or heap size limits.
3489            boolean sizeLimitReachedWithoutResults = sizeLimitReached && results.isEmpty();
3490            // We only want to mark a ScanResponse as a heartbeat message in the event that
3491            // there are more values to be read server side. If there aren't more values,
3492            // marking it as a heartbeat is wasteful because the client will need to issue
3493            // another ScanRequest only to realize that they already have all the values
3494            if (moreRows && (timeLimitReached || sizeLimitReachedWithoutResults)) {
3495              // Heartbeat messages occur when the time limit has been reached, or size limit has
3496              // been reached before collecting any results. This can happen for heavily filtered
3497              // scans which scan over too many blocks.
3498              builder.setHeartbeatMessage(true);
3499              if (rsh.needCursor) {
3500                Cell cursorCell = scannerContext.getLastPeekedCell();
3501                if (cursorCell != null) {
3502                  builder.setCursor(ProtobufUtil.toCursor(cursorCell));
3503                }
3504              }
3505            }
3506            break;
3507          }
3508          values.clear();
3509        }
3510        if (rpcCall != null) {
3511          rpcCall.incrementResponseCellSize(scannerContext.getHeapSizeProgress());
3512        }
3513        builder.setMoreResultsInRegion(moreRows);
3514        // Check to see if the client requested that we track metrics server side. If the
3515        // client requested metrics, retrieve the metrics from the scanner context.
3516        if (trackMetrics) {
3517          // rather than increment yet another counter in StoreScanner, just set the value here
3518          // from block size progress before writing into the response
3519          scannerContext.getMetrics().countOfBlockBytesScanned
3520            .set(scannerContext.getBlockSizeProgress());
3521          if (rpcCall != null) {
3522            scannerContext.getMetrics().fsReadTime.set(rpcCall.getFsReadTime());
3523          }
3524          Map<String, Long> metrics = scannerContext.getMetrics().getMetricsMap();
3525          ScanMetrics.Builder metricBuilder = ScanMetrics.newBuilder();
3526          NameInt64Pair.Builder pairBuilder = NameInt64Pair.newBuilder();
3527
3528          for (Entry<String, Long> entry : metrics.entrySet()) {
3529            pairBuilder.setName(entry.getKey());
3530            pairBuilder.setValue(entry.getValue());
3531            metricBuilder.addMetrics(pairBuilder.build());
3532          }
3533
3534          builder.setScanMetrics(metricBuilder.build());
3535        }
3536      }
3537    } finally {
3538      region.closeRegionOperation();
3539      // Update serverside metrics, even on error.
3540      long end = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
3541
3542      long responseCellSize = 0;
3543      long blockBytesScanned = 0;
3544      if (rpcCall != null) {
3545        responseCellSize = rpcCall.getResponseCellSize();
3546        blockBytesScanned = rpcCall.getBlockBytesScanned();
3547        rsh.updateBlockBytesScanned(blockBytesScanned);
3548      }
3549      region.getMetrics().updateScan();
3550      final MetricsRegionServer metricsRegionServer = server.getMetrics();
3551      if (metricsRegionServer != null) {
3552        metricsRegionServer.updateScan(region, end - before, responseCellSize, blockBytesScanned);
3553        metricsRegionServer.updateReadQueryMeter(region, numOfNextRawCalls);
3554      }
3555    }
3556    // coprocessor postNext hook
3557    if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3558      region.getCoprocessorHost().postScannerNext(scanner, results, maxResults, true);
3559    }
3560  }
3561
3562  /**
3563   * Scan data in a table.
3564   * @param controller the RPC controller
3565   * @param request    the scan request
3566   */
3567  @Override
3568  public ScanResponse scan(final RpcController controller, final ScanRequest request)
3569    throws ServiceException {
3570    if (controller != null && !(controller instanceof HBaseRpcController)) {
3571      throw new UnsupportedOperationException(
3572        "We only do " + "HBaseRpcControllers! FIX IF A PROBLEM: " + controller);
3573    }
3574    if (!request.hasScannerId() && !request.hasScan()) {
3575      throw new ServiceException(
3576        new DoNotRetryIOException("Missing required input: scannerId or scan"));
3577    }
3578    try {
3579      checkOpen();
3580    } catch (IOException e) {
3581      if (request.hasScannerId()) {
3582        String scannerName = toScannerName(request.getScannerId());
3583        if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
3584          LOG.debug(
3585            "Server shutting down and client tried to access missing scanner " + scannerName);
3586        }
3587        final LeaseManager leaseManager = server.getLeaseManager();
3588        if (leaseManager != null) {
3589          try {
3590            leaseManager.cancelLease(scannerName);
3591          } catch (LeaseException le) {
3592            // No problem, ignore
3593            if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
3594              LOG.trace("Un-able to cancel lease of scanner. It could already be closed.");
3595            }
3596          }
3597        }
3598      }
3599      throw new ServiceException(e);
3600    }
3601    requestCount.increment();
3602    rpcScanRequestCount.increment();
3603    RegionScannerContext rsx;
3604    ScanResponse.Builder builder = ScanResponse.newBuilder();
3605    try {
3606      rsx = checkQuotaAndGetRegionScannerContext(request, builder);
3607    } catch (IOException e) {
3608      if (e == SCANNER_ALREADY_CLOSED) {
3609        // Now we will close scanner automatically if there are no more results for this region but
3610        // the old client will still send a close request to us. Just ignore it and return.
3611        return builder.build();
3612      }
3613      throw new ServiceException(e);
3614    }
3615    String scannerName = rsx.scannerName;
3616    RegionScannerHolder rsh = rsx.holder;
3617    OperationQuota quota = rsx.quota;
3618    if (rsh.fullRegionScan) {
3619      rpcFullScanRequestCount.increment();
3620    }
3621    HRegion region = rsh.r;
3622    LeaseManager.Lease lease;
3623    try {
3624      // Remove lease while its being processed in server; protects against case
3625      // where processing of request takes > lease expiration time. or null if none found.
3626      lease = server.getLeaseManager().removeLease(scannerName);
3627    } catch (LeaseException e) {
3628      throw new ServiceException(e);
3629    }
3630    if (request.hasRenew() && request.getRenew()) {
3631      // add back and return
3632      addScannerLeaseBack(lease);
3633      try {
3634        checkScanNextCallSeq(request, rsh);
3635      } catch (OutOfOrderScannerNextException e) {
3636        throw new ServiceException(e);
3637      }
3638      return builder.build();
3639    }
3640    try {
3641      checkScanNextCallSeq(request, rsh);
3642    } catch (OutOfOrderScannerNextException e) {
3643      addScannerLeaseBack(lease);
3644      throw new ServiceException(e);
3645    }
3646    // Now we have increased the next call sequence. If we give client an error, the retry will
3647    // never success. So we'd better close the scanner and return a DoNotRetryIOException to client
3648    // and then client will try to open a new scanner.
3649    boolean closeScanner = request.hasCloseScanner() ? request.getCloseScanner() : false;
3650    int rows; // this is scan.getCaching
3651    if (request.hasNumberOfRows()) {
3652      rows = request.getNumberOfRows();
3653    } else {
3654      rows = closeScanner ? 0 : 1;
3655    }
3656    RpcCall rpcCall = RpcServer.getCurrentCall().orElse(null);
3657    // now let's do the real scan.
3658    long maxQuotaResultSize = Math.min(maxScannerResultSize, quota.getMaxResultSize());
3659    RegionScanner scanner = rsh.s;
3660    // this is the limit of rows for this scan, if we the number of rows reach this value, we will
3661    // close the scanner.
3662    int limitOfRows;
3663    if (request.hasLimitOfRows()) {
3664      limitOfRows = request.getLimitOfRows();
3665    } else {
3666      limitOfRows = -1;
3667    }
3668    boolean scannerClosed = false;
3669    try {
3670      List<Result> results = new ArrayList<>(Math.min(rows, 512));
3671      if (rows > 0) {
3672        boolean done = false;
3673        // Call coprocessor. Get region info from scanner.
3674        if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3675          Boolean bypass = region.getCoprocessorHost().preScannerNext(scanner, results, rows);
3676          if (!results.isEmpty()) {
3677            for (Result r : results) {
3678              // add cell size from CP results so we can track response size and update limits
3679              // when calling scan below if !done. We'll also have tracked block size if the CP
3680              // got results from hbase, since StoreScanner tracks that for all calls automatically.
3681              addSize(rpcCall, r);
3682            }
3683          }
3684          if (bypass != null && bypass.booleanValue()) {
3685            done = true;
3686          }
3687        }
3688        if (!done) {
3689          scan((HBaseRpcController) controller, request, rsh, maxQuotaResultSize, rows, limitOfRows,
3690            results, builder, rpcCall);
3691        } else {
3692          builder.setMoreResultsInRegion(!results.isEmpty());
3693        }
3694      } else {
3695        // This is a open scanner call with numberOfRow = 0, so set more results in region to true.
3696        builder.setMoreResultsInRegion(true);
3697      }
3698
3699      quota.addScanResult(results);
3700      addResults(builder, results, (HBaseRpcController) controller,
3701        RegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(region.getRegionInfo()),
3702        isClientCellBlockSupport(rpcCall));
3703      if (scanner.isFilterDone() && results.isEmpty()) {
3704        // If the scanner's filter - if any - is done with the scan
3705        // only set moreResults to false if the results is empty. This is used to keep compatible
3706        // with the old scan implementation where we just ignore the returned results if moreResults
3707        // is false. Can remove the isEmpty check after we get rid of the old implementation.
3708        builder.setMoreResults(false);
3709      }
3710      // Later we may close the scanner depending on this flag so here we need to make sure that we
3711      // have already set this flag.
3712      assert builder.hasMoreResultsInRegion();
3713      // we only set moreResults to false in the above code, so set it to true if we haven't set it
3714      // yet.
3715      if (!builder.hasMoreResults()) {
3716        builder.setMoreResults(true);
3717      }
3718      if (builder.getMoreResults() && builder.getMoreResultsInRegion() && !results.isEmpty()) {
3719        // Record the last cell of the last result if it is a partial result
3720        // We need this to calculate the complete rows we have returned to client as the
3721        // mayHaveMoreCellsInRow is true does not mean that there will be extra cells for the
3722        // current row. We may filter out all the remaining cells for the current row and just
3723        // return the cells of the nextRow when calling RegionScanner.nextRaw. So here we need to
3724        // check for row change.
3725        Result lastResult = results.get(results.size() - 1);
3726        if (lastResult.mayHaveMoreCellsInRow()) {
3727          rsh.rowOfLastPartialResult = lastResult.getRow();
3728        } else {
3729          rsh.rowOfLastPartialResult = null;
3730        }
3731      }
3732      if (!builder.getMoreResults() || !builder.getMoreResultsInRegion() || closeScanner) {
3733        scannerClosed = true;
3734        closeScanner(region, scanner, scannerName, rpcCall, false);
3735      }
3736
3737      // There's no point returning to a timed out client. Throwing ensures scanner is closed
3738      if (rpcCall != null && EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() > rpcCall.getDeadline()) {
3739        throw new TimeoutIOException("Client deadline exceeded, cannot return results");
3740      }
3741
3742      return builder.build();
3743    } catch (IOException e) {
3744      try {
3745        // scanner is closed here
3746        scannerClosed = true;
3747        // The scanner state might be left in a dirty state, so we will tell the Client to
3748        // fail this RPC and close the scanner while opening up another one from the start of
3749        // row that the client has last seen.
3750        closeScanner(region, scanner, scannerName, rpcCall, true);
3751
3752        // If it is a DoNotRetryIOException already, throw as it is. Unfortunately, DNRIOE is
3753        // used in two different semantics.
3754        // (1) The first is to close the client scanner and bubble up the exception all the way
3755        // to the application. This is preferred when the exception is really un-recoverable
3756        // (like CorruptHFileException, etc). Plain DoNotRetryIOException also falls into this
3757        // bucket usually.
3758        // (2) Second semantics is to close the current region scanner only, but continue the
3759        // client scanner by overriding the exception. This is usually UnknownScannerException,
3760        // OutOfOrderScannerNextException, etc where the region scanner has to be closed, but the
3761        // application-level ClientScanner has to continue without bubbling up the exception to
3762        // the client. See ClientScanner code to see how it deals with these special exceptions.
3763        if (e instanceof DoNotRetryIOException) {
3764          throw e;
3765        }
3766
3767        // If it is a FileNotFoundException, wrap as a
3768        // DoNotRetryIOException. This can avoid the retry in ClientScanner.
3769        if (e instanceof FileNotFoundException) {
3770          throw new DoNotRetryIOException(e);
3771        }
3772
3773        // We closed the scanner already. Instead of throwing the IOException, and client
3774        // retrying with the same scannerId only to get USE on the next RPC, we directly throw
3775        // a special exception to save an RPC.
3776        if (VersionInfoUtil.hasMinimumVersion(rpcCall.getClientVersionInfo(), 1, 4)) {
3777          // 1.4.0+ clients know how to handle
3778          throw new ScannerResetException("Scanner is closed on the server-side", e);
3779        } else {
3780          // older clients do not know about SRE. Just throw USE, which they will handle
3781          throw new UnknownScannerException("Throwing UnknownScannerException to reset the client"
3782            + " scanner state for clients older than 1.3.", e);
3783        }
3784      } catch (IOException ioe) {
3785        throw new ServiceException(ioe);
3786      }
3787    } finally {
3788      if (!scannerClosed) {
3789        // Adding resets expiration time on lease.
3790        // the closeCallBack will be set in closeScanner so here we only care about shippedCallback
3791        if (rpcCall != null) {
3792          rpcCall.setCallBack(rsh.shippedCallback);
3793        } else {
3794          // If context is null,here we call rsh.shippedCallback directly to reuse the logic in
3795          // rsh.shippedCallback to release the internal resources in rsh,and lease is also added
3796          // back to regionserver's LeaseManager in rsh.shippedCallback.
3797          runShippedCallback(rsh);
3798        }
3799      }
3800      quota.close();
3801    }
3802  }
3803
3804  private void runShippedCallback(RegionScannerHolder rsh) throws ServiceException {
3805    assert rsh.shippedCallback != null;
3806    try {
3807      rsh.shippedCallback.run();
3808    } catch (IOException ioe) {
3809      throw new ServiceException(ioe);
3810    }
3811  }
3812
3813  private void closeScanner(HRegion region, RegionScanner scanner, String scannerName,
3814    RpcCallContext context, boolean isError) throws IOException {
3815    if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3816      if (region.getCoprocessorHost().preScannerClose(scanner)) {
3817        // bypass the actual close.
3818        return;
3819      }
3820    }
3821    RegionScannerHolder rsh = scanners.remove(scannerName);
3822    if (rsh != null) {
3823      if (context != null) {
3824        context.setCallBack(rsh.closeCallBack);
3825      } else {
3826        rsh.s.close();
3827      }
3828      if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3829        region.getCoprocessorHost().postScannerClose(scanner);
3830      }
3831      if (!isError) {
3832        closedScanners.put(scannerName, rsh.getNextCallSeq());
3833      }
3834    }
3835  }
3836
3837  @Override
3838  public CoprocessorServiceResponse execRegionServerService(RpcController controller,
3839    CoprocessorServiceRequest request) throws ServiceException {
3840    rpcPreCheck("execRegionServerService");
3841    return server.execRegionServerService(controller, request);
3842  }
3843
3844  @Override
3845  public GetSpaceQuotaSnapshotsResponse getSpaceQuotaSnapshots(RpcController controller,
3846    GetSpaceQuotaSnapshotsRequest request) throws ServiceException {
3847    try {
3848      final RegionServerSpaceQuotaManager manager = server.getRegionServerSpaceQuotaManager();
3849      final GetSpaceQuotaSnapshotsResponse.Builder builder =
3850        GetSpaceQuotaSnapshotsResponse.newBuilder();
3851      if (manager != null) {
3852        final Map<TableName, SpaceQuotaSnapshot> snapshots = manager.copyQuotaSnapshots();
3853        for (Entry<TableName, SpaceQuotaSnapshot> snapshot : snapshots.entrySet()) {
3854          builder.addSnapshots(TableQuotaSnapshot.newBuilder()
3855            .setTableName(ProtobufUtil.toProtoTableName(snapshot.getKey()))
3856            .setSnapshot(SpaceQuotaSnapshot.toProtoSnapshot(snapshot.getValue())).build());
3857        }
3858      }
3859      return builder.build();
3860    } catch (Exception e) {
3861      throw new ServiceException(e);
3862    }
3863  }
3864
3865  @Override
3866  public ClearRegionBlockCacheResponse clearRegionBlockCache(RpcController controller,
3867    ClearRegionBlockCacheRequest request) throws ServiceException {
3868    try {
3869      rpcPreCheck("clearRegionBlockCache");
3870      ClearRegionBlockCacheResponse.Builder builder = ClearRegionBlockCacheResponse.newBuilder();
3871      CacheEvictionStatsBuilder stats = CacheEvictionStats.builder();
3872      server.getRegionServerCoprocessorHost().preClearRegionBlockCache();
3873      List<HRegion> regions = getRegions(request.getRegionList(), stats);
3874      for (HRegion region : regions) {
3875        try {
3876          stats = stats.append(this.server.clearRegionBlockCache(region));
3877        } catch (Exception e) {
3878          stats.addException(region.getRegionInfo().getRegionName(), e);
3879        }
3880      }
3881      stats.withMaxCacheSize(server.getBlockCache().map(BlockCache::getMaxSize).orElse(0L));
3882      server.getRegionServerCoprocessorHost().postClearRegionBlockCache(stats.build());
3883      return builder.setStats(ProtobufUtil.toCacheEvictionStats(stats.build())).build();
3884    } catch (IOException e) {
3885      throw new ServiceException(e);
3886    }
3887  }
3888
3889  private void executeOpenRegionProcedures(OpenRegionRequest request,
3890    Map<TableName, TableDescriptor> tdCache) {
3891    long masterSystemTime = request.hasMasterSystemTime() ? request.getMasterSystemTime() : -1;
3892    long initiatingMasterActiveTime =
3893      request.hasInitiatingMasterActiveTime() ? request.getInitiatingMasterActiveTime() : -1;
3894    for (RegionOpenInfo regionOpenInfo : request.getOpenInfoList()) {
3895      RegionInfo regionInfo = ProtobufUtil.toRegionInfo(regionOpenInfo.getRegion());
3896      TableName tableName = regionInfo.getTable();
3897      TableDescriptor tableDesc = tdCache.get(tableName);
3898      if (tableDesc == null) {
3899        try {
3900          tableDesc = server.getTableDescriptors().get(regionInfo.getTable());
3901        } catch (IOException e) {
3902          // Here we do not fail the whole method since we also need deal with other
3903          // procedures, and we can not ignore this one, so we still schedule a
3904          // AssignRegionHandler and it will report back to master if we still can not get the
3905          // TableDescriptor.
3906          LOG.warn("Failed to get TableDescriptor of {}, will try again in the handler",
3907            regionInfo.getTable(), e);
3908        }
3909        if (tableDesc != null) {
3910          tdCache.put(tableName, tableDesc);
3911        }
3912      }
3913      if (regionOpenInfo.getFavoredNodesCount() > 0) {
3914        server.updateRegionFavoredNodesMapping(regionInfo.getEncodedName(),
3915          regionOpenInfo.getFavoredNodesList());
3916      }
3917      long procId = regionOpenInfo.getOpenProcId();
3918      if (server.submitRegionProcedure(procId)) {
3919        server.getExecutorService().submit(AssignRegionHandler.create(server, regionInfo, procId,
3920          tableDesc, masterSystemTime, initiatingMasterActiveTime));
3921      }
3922    }
3923  }
3924
3925  private void executeCloseRegionProcedures(CloseRegionRequest request) {
3926    String encodedName;
3927    long initiatingMasterActiveTime =
3928      request.hasInitiatingMasterActiveTime() ? request.getInitiatingMasterActiveTime() : -1;
3929    try {
3930      encodedName = ProtobufUtil.getRegionEncodedName(request.getRegion());
3931    } catch (DoNotRetryIOException e) {
3932      throw new UncheckedIOException("Should not happen", e);
3933    }
3934    ServerName destination = request.hasDestinationServer()
3935      ? ProtobufUtil.toServerName(request.getDestinationServer())
3936      : null;
3937    long procId = request.getCloseProcId();
3938    boolean evictCache = request.getEvictCache();
3939    if (server.submitRegionProcedure(procId)) {
3940      server.getExecutorService().submit(UnassignRegionHandler.create(server, encodedName, procId,
3941        false, destination, evictCache, initiatingMasterActiveTime));
3942    }
3943  }
3944
3945  private void executeProcedures(RemoteProcedureRequest request) {
3946    RSProcedureCallable callable;
3947    try {
3948      callable = Class.forName(request.getProcClass()).asSubclass(RSProcedureCallable.class)
3949        .getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
3950    } catch (Exception e) {
3951      LOG.warn("Failed to instantiating remote procedure {}, pid={}", request.getProcClass(),
3952        request.getProcId(), e);
3953      server.remoteProcedureComplete(request.getProcId(), request.getInitiatingMasterActiveTime(),
3954        e);
3955      return;
3956    }
3957    callable.init(request.getProcData().toByteArray(), server);
3958    LOG.debug("Executing remote procedure {}, pid={}", callable.getClass(), request.getProcId());
3959    server.executeProcedure(request.getProcId(), request.getInitiatingMasterActiveTime(), callable);
3960  }
3961
3962  @Override
3963  @QosPriority(priority = HConstants.ADMIN_QOS)
3964  public ExecuteProceduresResponse executeProcedures(RpcController controller,
3965    ExecuteProceduresRequest request) throws ServiceException {
3966    try {
3967      checkOpen();
3968      throwOnWrongStartCode(request);
3969      server.getRegionServerCoprocessorHost().preExecuteProcedures();
3970      if (request.getOpenRegionCount() > 0) {
3971        // Avoid reading from the TableDescritor every time(usually it will read from the file
3972        // system)
3973        Map<TableName, TableDescriptor> tdCache = new HashMap<>();
3974        request.getOpenRegionList().forEach(req -> executeOpenRegionProcedures(req, tdCache));
3975      }
3976      if (request.getCloseRegionCount() > 0) {
3977        request.getCloseRegionList().forEach(this::executeCloseRegionProcedures);
3978      }
3979      if (request.getProcCount() > 0) {
3980        request.getProcList().forEach(this::executeProcedures);
3981      }
3982      server.getRegionServerCoprocessorHost().postExecuteProcedures();
3983      return ExecuteProceduresResponse.getDefaultInstance();
3984    } catch (IOException e) {
3985      throw new ServiceException(e);
3986    }
3987  }
3988
3989  @Override
3990  public GetAllBootstrapNodesResponse getAllBootstrapNodes(RpcController controller,
3991    GetAllBootstrapNodesRequest request) throws ServiceException {
3992    GetAllBootstrapNodesResponse.Builder builder = GetAllBootstrapNodesResponse.newBuilder();
3993    server.getBootstrapNodes()
3994      .forEachRemaining(server -> builder.addNode(ProtobufUtil.toServerName(server)));
3995    return builder.build();
3996  }
3997
3998  private void setReloadableGuardrails(Configuration conf) {
3999    rowSizeWarnThreshold =
4000      conf.getInt(HConstants.BATCH_ROWS_THRESHOLD_NAME, HConstants.BATCH_ROWS_THRESHOLD_DEFAULT);
4001    rejectRowsWithSizeOverThreshold =
4002      conf.getBoolean(REJECT_BATCH_ROWS_OVER_THRESHOLD, DEFAULT_REJECT_BATCH_ROWS_OVER_THRESHOLD);
4003    maxScannerResultSize = conf.getLong(HConstants.HBASE_SERVER_SCANNER_MAX_RESULT_SIZE_KEY,
4004      HConstants.DEFAULT_HBASE_SERVER_SCANNER_MAX_RESULT_SIZE);
4005  }
4006
4007  @Override
4008  public void onConfigurationChange(Configuration conf) {
4009    super.onConfigurationChange(conf);
4010    setReloadableGuardrails(conf);
4011  }
4012
4013  @Override
4014  public GetCachedFilesListResponse getCachedFilesList(RpcController controller,
4015    GetCachedFilesListRequest request) throws ServiceException {
4016    GetCachedFilesListResponse.Builder responseBuilder = GetCachedFilesListResponse.newBuilder();
4017    List<String> fullyCachedFiles = new ArrayList<>();
4018    server.getBlockCache().flatMap(BlockCache::getFullyCachedFiles).ifPresent(fcf -> {
4019      fullyCachedFiles.addAll(fcf.keySet());
4020    });
4021    return responseBuilder.addAllCachedFiles(fullyCachedFiles).build();
4022  }
4023
4024  RegionScannerContext checkQuotaAndGetRegionScannerContext(ScanRequest request,
4025    ScanResponse.Builder builder) throws IOException {
4026    if (request.hasScannerId()) {
4027      // The downstream projects such as AsyncHBase in OpenTSDB need this value. See HBASE-18000
4028      // for more details.
4029      long scannerId = request.getScannerId();
4030      builder.setScannerId(scannerId);
4031      String scannerName = toScannerName(scannerId);
4032      RegionScannerHolder rsh = getRegionScanner(request);
4033      OperationQuota quota =
4034        getRpcQuotaManager().checkScanQuota(rsh.r, request, maxScannerResultSize,
4035          rsh.getMaxBlockBytesScanned(), rsh.getPrevBlockBytesScannedDifference());
4036      return new RegionScannerContext(scannerName, rsh, quota);
4037    }
4038
4039    HRegion region = getRegion(request.getRegion());
4040    OperationQuota quota =
4041      getRpcQuotaManager().checkScanQuota(region, request, maxScannerResultSize, 0L, 0L);
4042    Pair<String, RegionScannerHolder> pair = newRegionScanner(request, region, builder);
4043    return new RegionScannerContext(pair.getFirst(), pair.getSecond(), quota);
4044  }
4045}
